intro: Mesembryanthemum forskahlii, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Its flowers typically bloom in summer, adding vibrant color to rocky landscapes. Mesembryanthemum forskahlii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
